title: Syrian refugee facing jail after being caught with alligator and orangutan porn
text:
Chadi Amiri was told he faces a jail sentence (Picture: Chadi Amiri/Facebook)

A Syrian refugee caught with a stash of sick porn involving humans with orangutans and alligators was told he faces a jail sentence.

Chadi Amiri, 24, also had images and films of child abuse when police raided his home.

He resettled in Scotland as part of the UK government’s plan to rehouse 20,000 refugees fleeing the civil war in Syria.

But police found out his crimes after noticing his IP address had been used to download indecent images.

They then found out he had been using WhatsApp to share the depraved material.

Amiri, of Coatbridge, Lanarkshire, appeared at Airdrie Sheriff Court and admitted three charges of taking or permitting indecent images of children to be taken, distributing images and possessing extreme pornography between January and December last year.

He had images of humans abusing an alligator (Stock picture: Getty)

An allegation he performed a circumcision on a baby without any anaesthetic and had closed the wound with a soldering device between August 2017 and December 2018 while acting with others was dropped by prosecutors.

Depute fiscal Elizabeth Ross said: ‘In December, police attended at the home of the accused and were allowed entry where a search was carried out during which a Samsung phone was seized.

‘He admitted it was his phone and provided police with a password for it.

‘Indecent images were later recovered from this mobile phone and it contained both still and moving images involving male children aged between one and 14.

‘They were being sent through WhatsApp and he distributed one category A image to seven WhatsApp users on nine separate occasions.

‘There were also unique images of extreme pornography featuring an orangutan and an alligator.

‘He was arrested and charged.’

Fraser McKinnon, defending, said: ‘I would ask that his status be continued not withstanding the indication that he has already been given so he can get his affairs in order.’

Amiri spoke at an event with other refugees in 2017 and described the horrors of the war torn country where he was kidnapped near Damascus by government forces and tortured in a detention centre.

He said he was only released after his family paid a ransom and they fled.

Sheriff O’Carroll said: ‘I will have to call for reports in this matter but I should advise the accused that a custodial sentence will be at the forefront of this court’s mind when the case next calls.’
